methods.name: createBeaconIdentityConstraint
methods.summary: create a constraint that describes the identity caracteristics of a beacon.

parameters.name: major
parameters.summary: Most significant value associated with the constraint. If a major value wasn't specified, this will be nil.

parameters.name: minor
parameters.summary: Least significant value associated with the constraint. If a minor value wasn't specified, this will be nil.

parameters.name: permission
parameters.summary: The permission for descriptor. This parameter is only for android. In android, the permissions can be different for characteristic and descriptor. If Characteristic have the read permission then it is only readable and if descriptor have the write permission, then it is only writable.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.summary: Characteristic properties determine how the characteristic value can be used, or how the descriptor(s) can be accessed.

methods.name: createRegionManager
methods.summary: create a region manager to scan beacons.

methods.name: disable
methods.description: This method requires the BLUETOOTH and BLUETOOTH_ADMIN permissions to successfully work. To check whether these permissions are granted or not, call isBluetoothAndBluetoothAdminPermissionsGranted method. Listen for the didUpdateState event to be notified when the local Bluetooth adapter is turning off.

returns.summary: Returns true if the process is initiated successfully or when the bluetooth is already off.

methods.name: enable
methods.description: This method requires the BLUETOOTH and BLUETOOTH_ADMIN permissions to successfully work. To check whether these permissions are granted or not, call isBluetoothAndBluetoothAdminPermissionsGranted method. Listen for the didUpdateState event to be notified when the local Bluetooth adapter is turning on.

returns.summary: Returns true if the process is initiated successfully or when the bluetooth is already on.

methods.name: initCentralManager
methods.summary: Initializes the module's central manager. This function must be called in an app that acts as a central before any other function can be used.

parameters.name: showPowerAlert
parameters.summary: A Boolean value that specifies whether the system warns the user if the app instantiates the central manager when Bluetooth service isn‚Äôt available.

parameters.name: restoreIdentifier
parameters.summary: A string containing a unique identifier (UID) for the central manager to instantiate.

methods.name: initPeripheralManager
methods.summary: Initializes the module's peripheral manager object. This function must be called in an app that acts as a peripheral before any other function can be used.

parameters.name: showPowerAlert
parameters.summary: A Boolean value that specifies whether the system warns the user if the app instantiates the peripheral manager when Bluetooth service isn‚Äôt available.

parameters.name: restoreIdentifier
parameters.summary: A string containing a unique identifier (UID) for the peripheral manager to instantiate.

methods.name: isAdvertisingSupported
methods.summary: Determines whether Bluetooth Low Energy Advertising feature is supported on the local Bluetooth device.

returns.summary: Returns true if BLE Advertising is supported on the device, false on bluetooth off or if BLE Advertising is not supported.

methods.name: isBluetoothAndBluetoothAdminPermissionsGranted
methods.summary: Determines whether the BLUETOOTH and BLUETOOTH_ADMIN permissions are granted or not.

returns.summary: Returns true if the BLUETOOTH and BLUETOOTH_ADMIN permissions are granted

methods.name: isEnabled
methods.summary: Determines if Bluetooth is currently enabled and ready for use.

returns.summary: Returns true if the local adapter is on.

methods.name: isSupported
methods.summary: Determines whether Bluetooth Low Energy feature is supported on the local Bluetooth device.

returns.summary: Returns true if BLE is supported on the device, false otherwise.

constants.name: ADVERT_DATA_KEY_IS_CONNECTABLE
constants.summary: A Boolean value that indicates whether the advertising event type is connectable.
constants.description: The value for this key is an Number object. You can use this value to determine whether your app can currently connect to a peripheral.

constants.name: ADVERT_DATA_KEY_LOCAL_NAME
constants.summary: The local name of a peripheral.
constants.description: The value associated with this key is an String.

constants.name: ADVERT_DATA_KEY_MANUFACTURER_DATA
constants.summary: The manufacturer data of a peripheral.
constants.description: The value associated with this key is an TiBuffer object.

constants.name: ADVERT_DATA_KEY_OVERFLOW_SERVICE_UUIDS
constants.summary: An array of UUIDs found in the overflow area of the advertisement data.
constants.description: The value associated with this key is an array of one or more String objects, representing Service UUIDs. Because data stored in this area results from not fitting in the main advertisement, UUIDs listed here are ‚Äúbest effort‚Äù and may not always be accurate. For details about the overflow area of advertisement data, see the startAdvertising(_üòÉ method in PeripheralManager.

constants.name: ADVERT_DATA_KEY_SERVICE_DATA
constants.summary: A dictionary that contains service-specific advertisement data.
constants.description: The keys (Strings objects) represent Service UUIDs, and the values (TiBuffer objects) represent service-specific data.

constants.name: ADVERT_DATA_KEY_SERVICE_UUIDS
constants.summary: An array of service UUIDs.
constants.description: The value associated with this key is an Array object.

constants.name: ADVERT_DATA_KEY_SOLICITED_SERVICE_UUIDS
constants.summary: An array of solicited service UUIDs.
constants.description: The value associated with this key is an array of one or more String objects, representing Service UUIDs.

constants.name: ADVERT_DATA_KEY_TX_POWER_LEVEL
constants.summary: The transmit power of a peripheral.
constants.description: The value associated with this key is an instance of Number. This key and value are available if the peripheral provides its transmitting power level in its advertising packet. You can calculate the path loss by comparing the RSSI value with the transmitting power level.

constants.name: ATT_ATTRIBUTE_NOT_FOUND_ERROR
constants.summary: The attribute wasn‚Äôt found within the specified attribute handle range.

constants.name: ATT_ATTRIBUTE_NOT_LONG_ERROR
constants.summary: The ATT read blob request can‚Äôt read or write the attribute.

constants.name: ATT_FAILURE
constants.summary: The ATT command or request failed.

constants.name: ATT_INSUFFICIENT_AUTHENTICATION_ERROR
constants.summary: Reading or writing the attribute‚Äôs value failed for lack of authentication.

constants.name: ATT_INSUFFICIENT_AUTHORIZATION_ERROR
constants.summary: Reading or writing the attribute‚Äôs value failed for lack of authorization.

constants.name: ATT_INSUFFICIENT_ENCRYPTION_ERROR
constants.summary: Reading or writing the attribute‚Äôs value failed for lack of encryption.

constants.name: ATT_INSUFFICIENT_ENCRYPTION_KEY_SIZE_ERROR
constants.summary: The encryption key size used for encrypting this link is insufficient.

constants.name: ATT_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES_ERROR
constants.summary: Resources are insufficient to complete the ATT request.

constants.name: ATT_INVALID_ATTRIBUTE_VALUE_LENGTH_ERROR
constants.summary: The length of the attribute‚Äôs value is invalid for the intended operation.

constants.name: ATT_INVALID_HANDLE_ERROR
constants.summary: The attribute handle is invalid on this peripheral.

constants.name: ATT_INVALID_OFFSET_ERROR
constants.summary: The specified offset value was past the end of the attribute‚Äôs value.

constants.name: ATT_INVALID_PDU_ERROR
constants.summary: The attribute Protocol Data Unit (PDU) is invalid.

constants.name: ATT_PREPARE_QUEUE_FULL_ERROR
constants.summary: The prepare queue is full, as a result of there being too many write requests in the queue.

constants.name: ATT_READ_NOT_PERMITTED_ERROR
constants.summary: The permissions prohibit reading the attribute‚Äôs value.

constants.name: ATT_REQUEST_NOT_SUPPORTED_ERROR
constants.summary: The attribute server doesn‚Äôt support the request received from the client.

constants.name: ATT_SUCCESS
constants.summary: The ATT command or request successfully completed.

constants.name: ATT_UNLIKELY_ERROR
constants.summary: The ATT request encountered an unlikely error and wasn‚Äôt completed.

constants.name: ATT_UNSUPPORTED_GROUP_TYPE_ERROR
constants.summary: The attribute type isn‚Äôt a supported grouping attribute as defined by a higher-layer specification.

constants.name: ATT_WRITE_NOT_PERMITTED_ERROR
constants.summary: The permissions prohibit writing the attribute‚Äôs value.

constants.name: AUTHORISATION_STATUS_ALLOWED_ALWAYS
constants.summary: A state that indicates the user has authorized Bluetooth at any time.

constants.name: AUTHORISATION_STATUS_DENIED
constants.summary: A state that indicates the user explicitly denied Bluetooth access for this app.

constants.name: AUTHORISATION_STATUS_NOT_DETERMINED
constants.summary: A state that indicates the user has yet to authorize Bluetooth for this app.

constants.name: AUTHORISATION_STATUS_RESTRICTED
constants.summary: A state that indicates this app isn‚Äôt authorized to use Bluetooth.

constants.name: BEACON_PROXIMITY_FAR
constants.summary: current state of the device with reference to a region is far

constants.name: BEACON_PROXIMITY_IMMEDIATE
constants.summary: current state of the device with reference to a region is immediate

constants.name: BEACON_PROXIMITY_NEAR
constants.summary: current state of the device with reference to a region is near

constants.name: BEACON_PROXIMITY_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: current state of the device with reference to a region is unknown

constants.name: CBUUID_CHARACTERISTIC_AGGREGATE_FORMAT_STRING
constants.summary: The UUID for the Aggregate Format descriptor, as a string.

constants.name: CBUUID_CHARACTERISTIC_EXTENDED_PROPERTIES_STRING
constants.summary: The UUID for the Extended Properties descriptor, as a string. The corresponding value for this descriptor is an NSNumber object.

constants.name: CBUUID_CHARACTERISTIC_FORMAT_STRING
constants.summary: The UUID for the Presentation Format descriptor, as a string. The corresponding value for this descriptor is an NSData object.

constants.name: CBUUID_CHARACTERISTIC_USER_DESCRIPTION_STRING
constants.summary: The UUID for the User Description descriptor, as a string. The corresponding value for this descriptor is an NSString object.

constants.name: CBUUID_CLIENT_CHARACTERISTIC_CONFIGURATION_STRING
constants.summary: The UUID for the Client Configuration descriptor, as a string. In iOS, the corresponding value for this descriptor is an NSNumber object. In android, it is a 32 bit uuid.

constants.name: CBUUID_L2CAPPSM_CHARACTERISTIC_STRING
constants.summary: The PSM of an L2CAP channel associated with the GATT service containing this characteristic.This PSM is a little-endian UInt16. Servers can publish this characteristic with the UUID ABDD3056-28FA-441D-A470-55A75A52553A.

constants.name: CBUUID_SERVER_CHARACTERISTIC_CONFIGURATION_STRING
constants.summary: The UUID for the Server Configuration descriptor, as a string. The corresponding value for this descriptor is an NSNumber object.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PERMISSION_READ_ENCRYPTED
constants.summary: A permission that indicates only trusted devices can read the attribute‚Äôs value.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PERMISSION_READABLE
constants.summary: A permission that indicates a peripheral can read the attribute‚Äôs value.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PERMISSION_WRITE_ENCRYPTED
constants.summary: A permission that indicates only trusted devices can write the attribute‚Äôs value.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PERMISSION_WRITEABLE
constants.summary: A permission that indicates a peripheral can write the attribute‚Äôs value.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PROPERTIES_AUTHENTICATED_SIGNED_WRITES
constants.summary: A property that indicates the perhipheral allows signed writes of the characteristic‚Äôs value, without a response to indicate the write succeeded.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PROPERTIES_BROADCAST
constants.summary: A property that indicates the characteristic can broadcast its value using a characteristic configuration descriptor.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PROPERTIES_EXTENDED_PROPERTIES
constants.summary: A property that indicates the characteristic defines additional properties in the extended properties descriptor.A property that indicates the characteristic defines additional properties in the extended properties descriptor.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PROPERTIES_INDICATE
constants.summary: A property that indicates the peripheral permits notifications of the characteristic‚Äôs value, with a response from the central to indicate receipt of the notification.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PROPERTIES_INDICATE_ENCRYPTION_REQUIRED
constants.summary: A property that indicates only trusted devices can enable indications of the characteristic‚Äôs value.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PROPERTIES_NOTIFY
constants.summary: A property that indicates the peripheral permits notifications of the characteristic‚Äôs value, without a response from the central to indicate receipt of the notification.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PROPERTIES_NOTIFY_ENCRYPTION_REQUIRED
constants.summary: A property that indicates that only trusted devices can enable notifications of the characteristic‚Äôs value.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PROPERTIES_READ
constants.summary: A property that indicates a peripheral can read the characteristic‚Äôs value.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PROPERTIES_WRITE
constants.summary: A property that indicates a peripheral can write the characteristic‚Äôs value, with a response to indicate that the write succeeded.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_PROPERTIES_WRITE_WITHOUT_RESPONSE
constants.summary: A property that indicates a peripheral can write the characteristic's value, without a response to indicate that the write succeeded.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_TYPE_WRITE_WITH_RESPONSE
constants.summary: Write a characteristic value, without any response from the peripheral to indicate whether the write was successful.

constants.name: CHARACTERISTIC_TYPE_WRITE_WITHOUT_RESPONSE
constants.summary: Write a characteristic value, with a response from the peripheral to indicate whether the write was successful.

constants.name: CONNECT_PERIPHERAL_OPTIONS_KEY_ENABLE_TRANSPORT_BRIDGING
constants.summary: An option to bridge classic Bluetooth technology profiles, if already connected over Bluetooth Low Energy.
constants.description: options object key used in Modules.BLE.CentralManager.connectPeripheral. This option tells the system to connect non-GATT profiles on classic Bluetooth devices, if there is a low energy GATT connection to the same device. A true value instructs the system to bring up classic transport profiles when a low energy transport peripheral connects. A false value tells the system not to use the profiles.

constants.name: CONNECT_PERIPHERAL_OPTIONS_KEY_NOTIFY_ON_CONNECTION
constants.summary: A Boolean value that specifies whether the system should display an alert when connecting a peripheral in the background.
constants.description: options object key used in Modules.BLE.CentralManager.connectPeripheral. The value for this key is an Boolean. This key is useful for apps that haven‚Äôt specified the bluetooth-central background mode and can‚Äôt display their own alert. If more than one app requests a notification for a given peripheral, the one that was most recently in the foreground receives the alert. If the key isn‚Äôt specified, the default value is false.

constants.name: CONNECT_PERIPHERAL_OPTIONS_KEY_NOTIFY_ON_DISCONNECTION
constants.summary: A Boolean value that specifies whether the system should display an alert when disconnecting a peripheral in the background.
constants.description: options object key used in Modules.BLE.CentralManager.connectPeripheral. The value for this key is an Boolean. This key is useful for apps that haven‚Äôt specified the bluetooth-central background mode and can‚Äôt display their own alert. If more than one app requests a notification for a given peripheral, the one that was most recently in the foreground receives the alert. If the key isn‚Äôt specified, the default value is false.

constants.name: CONNECT_PERIPHERAL_OPTIONS_KEY_NOTIFY_ON_NOTIFICATION
constants.summary: A Boolean value that specifies whether the system should display an alert for any notification sent by a peripheral.
constants.description: options object key used in Modules.BLE.CentralManager.connectPeripheral. If true, the system displays an alert for all notifications received from a given peripheral while the app is suspended. the default value is false.

constants.name: CONNECT_PERIPHERAL_OPTIONS_KEY_REQUIRES_ANCS
constants.summary: An option to require Apple Notification Center Service (ANCS) when connecting a device.

constants.name: CONNECT_PERIPHERAL_OPTIONS_KEY_START_DELAY
constants.summary: An option that indicates a delay before the system makes a connection.
constants.description: options object key used in Modules.BLE.CentralManager.connectPeripheral. The corresponding value is an Number that indicates the duration of the delay in seconds.

constants.name: CONNECTION_EVENT_TYPE_PEER_CONNECTED
constants.summary: Peer connected event type. This is 'event' type value for CENTREL_MANAGER_EVENT_PERIPHERAL_CONNECTION_EVENT_DID_OCCUR event.

constants.name: CONNECTION_EVENT_TYPE_PEER_DISCONNECTED
constants.summary: Peer disconnect event type. This is 'event' type value for CENTREL_MANAGER_EVENT_PERIPHERAL_CONNECTION_EVENT_DID_OCCUR event.

constants.name: CONNECTION_PRIORITY_BALANCED
constants.summary: Connection parameter recommended by the Bluetooth SIG.

constants.name: CONNECTION_PRIORITY_HIGH
constants.summary: For a high priority, low latency connection.

constants.name: CONNECTION_PRIORITY_LOW_POWER
constants.summary: For a low power, reduced data rate connection.

constants.name: DESCRIPTOR_PERMISSION_READ
constants.summary: A read permission for descriptor.

constants.name: DESCRIPTOR_PERMISSION_READ_ENCRYPTED
constants.summary: An encrypted read permission for descriptor.

constants.name: DESCRIPTOR_PERMISSION_WRITE
constants.summary: A write permission for descriptor.

constants.name: DESCRIPTOR_PERMISSION_WRITE_ENCRYPTED
constants.summary: An encrypted write permission for descriptor.

constants.name: DISABLE_NOTIFICATION_VALUE
constants.summary: Value used to disable notifications or indications for a client configuration descriptor. You may pass this constant to the unsubscribeFromCharacteristic method.

constants.name: ENABLE_INDICATION_VALUE
constants.summary: Value used to enable indication for a client configuration descriptor. You may pass this constant to the subscribeToCharacteristic method.

constants.name: ENABLE_NOTIFICATION_VALUE
constants.summary: Value used to enable notification for a client configuration descriptor. You may pass this constant to the subscribeToCharacteristic method.

constants.name: LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_AUTHORIZED_ALWAYS
constants.summary: User has granted authorization to use their location only while they are using your app.

constants.name: LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_AUTHORIZED_WHEN_IN_USE
constants.summary: Write a characteristic value, with a response from the peripheral to indicate whether the write was successful.

constants.name: LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_DENIED
constants.summary: User has explicitly denied authorization for this application, or location services are disabled in Settings.

constants.name: LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_NOT_DETERMINED
constants.summary: User has not yet made a choice with regards to this application

constants.name: LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_RESTRICTED
constants.summary: This application is not authorized to use location services. Due to active restrictions on location services, the user cannot change this status, and may not have personally denied authorization

constants.name: MANAGER_STATE_POWERED_OFF
constants.summary: A state that indicates Bluetooth is currently powered off.

constants.name: MANAGER_STATE_POWERED_ON
constants.summary: A state that indicates Bluetooth is currently powered on and available to use.

constants.name: MANAGER_STATE_RESETTING
constants.summary: A state that indicates the connection with the system service was momentarily lost.

constants.name: MANAGER_STATE_TURNING_OFF
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the state property. This value indicates that the local Bluetooth adapter is turning off.
constants.description: Listen for the didUpdateState event to be notified when the local Bluetooth adapter is turning off.

constants.name: MANAGER_STATE_TURNING_ON
constants.summary: One of the possible values returned by the state property. This value indicates that the local Bluetooth adapter is turning on.
constants.description: Listen for the didUpdateState event to be notified when the local Bluetooth adapter is turning on.

constants.name: MANAGER_STATE_UNAUTHORIZED
constants.summary: A state that indicates the application isn‚Äôt authorized to use the Bluetooth low energy role.

constants.name: MANAGER_STATE_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: The Peripheral and Central manager‚Äôs state is unknown

constants.name: MANAGER_STATE_UNSUPPORTED
constants.summary: A state that indicates this device doesn‚Äôt support the Bluetooth low energy central or client role.

constants.name: PERIPHERAL_MANAGER_CONNECTION_LATENCY_HIGH
constants.summary: A latency setting that prioritizes extending battery life over rapid communication.

constants.name: PERIPHERAL_MANAGER_CONNECTION_LATENCY_LOW
constants.summary: A latency setting indicating that prioritizes rapid communication over battery life.

constants.name: PERIPHERAL_MANAGER_CONNECTION_LATENCY_MEDIUM
constants.summary: A latency setting that balances communication frequency and battery life.

constants.name: PERIPHERAL_STATE_CONNECTED
constants.summary: The peripheral is connected to the central manager.

constants.name: PERIPHERAL_STATE_CONNECTING
constants.summary: The peripheral is in the process of connecting to the central manager.

constants.name: PERIPHERAL_STATE_DISCONNECTED
constants.summary: The peripheral isn‚Äôt connected to the central manager.

constants.name: PERIPHERAL_STATE_DISCONNECTING
constants.summary: The peripheral is disconnecting from the central manager.

constants.name: REGION_STATE_INSIDE
constants.summary: The current state of the device with reference to a region is inside

constants.name: REGION_STATE_OUTSIDE
constants.summary: The current state of the device with reference to a region is outside

constants.name: REGION_STATE_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: The current state of the device with reference to a region is unknown
